com.timtripcony
Class AbstractDocumentMapModel

java.lang.Object
  com.timtripcony.AbstractMapModel
      com.timtripcony.AbstractDocumentMapModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSmartDocumentModel
public abstract class AbstractDocumentMapModel
extends AbstractMapModel

Author:
Tim Tripcony, Paul Withers Extension of AbstractMapModel to add Document-related / XPages-related properties. Amended by PW to rely on OpenNTF Domino API (this allowed me to remove a lot of code Tim had repeated from ODA)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AbstractDocumentMapModel

public AbstractDocumentMapModel()
Constructor, calling overloaded constructor and simulating DominoDocument datasource, to get default Document based on URL

AbstractDocumentMapModel

public AbstractDocumentMapModel(java.lang.String documentId)
Overloaded constructor, added by PW, allowing loading based on documentId

ignoreRequestParams and requestParamPrefix are irrelevant. We're creating objects in Java, no point querying URL parameters here

Parameters:
documentId - String alternative UNID / Note ID from which to load Document

getFieldTypeMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.openntf.domino.Item.Type> getFieldTypeMap()
A Map of Item names and the specific Item type (e.g. READERS, AUTHORS etc). Added by PW

Returns:
Map specific Item types, where Key = Item name, Value = Item type

setFieldTypeMap

Load a Map of Item names and specific Item types (e.g. READERS, AUTHORS etc). Added by PW

Parameters:
fieldTypeMap - Map specific Item types, where Key = Item name, Value = Item type

public abstract java.lang.String getFormName()
Returns Form name to use for this Document

Returns:
String Form property of this Document

getFormDescription

public abstract java.lang.String getFormDescription()
Returns a description for the Form used for this Document, useful for displaying in Form Tables

Returns:
String Form description

initNew

public void initNew()
Sets the Document as a new note

load

public void load(java.lang.String unid)
Loads the object with settings based on the passed UNID:
      Whether or not it is a new Document
      Whether or not the Document is deleted
      Whether or not the Document is read only
      Sets wrappedDoc as a DominoDocument object
      Loads all fields into the object, omitting named fields, anything prefixed with "$", or with type "Error"
Extended by PW to allow specific fields to be ignored and to ensure empty fields are loaded as "" (empty String), not "[]" (String version of empty Vector)

Parameters:
unid - String UNID or Note ID relating to this Document (empty = new Document)

postSave

public boolean postSave()
PostSave event code to run

Returns:
boolean Success / Failure in running postSave code, required to handle onward routing

querySave

public boolean querySave()
QuerySave event code to run

Returns:
boolean success / Failure in running querySave code, required to handle onward routing

setSpecialFieldTypes

public boolean setSpecialFieldTypes(org.openntf.domino.Document doc)
Sets Item types based on fieldTypeMap. Currently only handles READERS, AUTHORS or NAMES

Parameters:
doc - Document being saved
Returns:
boolean success / failure of setting Item types

save

public boolean save()
Save of the Document, calling querySave at the start and postSave at the end

Returns:
boolean success / failure of the save

save

public java.lang.String save(boolean goToView)
Overloaded save method, allowing navigation handling to force return to a view, if required

Parameters:
goToView - boolean whether or not to go to the view
Returns:
String navigationRule name (defaults are xsp-success for going to next page, xsp-current to stay on current page)

getTypeConversionMap

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<?>> getTypeConversionMap()
Getter for typeConversionMap, to facilitate type conversion of Items. When loading item values into this object, if an Item name is found in this map, the value will be cast to the Class defined by this map for that Item. E.g. "date",Date.class will convert the "date" field to a Java Date.

Returns:
HashMap where the key is a String and the value is a Class

setTypeConversionMap

public void setTypeConversionMap(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<?>> typeConversionMap)
Setter for typeConversionMap, to facilitate type conversion of Items. E.g. where an item is a DateTime, that cannot be serialized, so will cause us problems. So an element would be added to the map to map the Item name to Date.class

Parameters:
typeConversionMap - HashMap where the key is a String and the value is a Class

initialiseTypeConversionMap

public void initialiseTypeConversionMap()
Initialises the map of fields with specific class types (i.e. types not automatically converted to Java objects
